summary: Generate FASTQ file(s) from Illumina basecall read data.

arguments.summary: Deprecated (No longer used). Which adapters to look for in the read.
arguments.name: --ADAPTERS_TO_CHECK

options.summary:
The following sequences can be found in
        https://support.illumina.com/content/dam/illumina-support/documents/documentation/chemistry_documentation/experiment-design/illumina-adapter-sequences_1000000002694-01.pdf
        and are protected by the following copyright notice:

        Oligonucleotide sequences (c) 2016 Illumina, Inc. All rights reserved. Derivative works created by
        Illumina customers are authorized for use with Illumina instruments and products only. All other
        uses are strictly prohibited.
options.name: PAIRED_END

arguments.summary: Apply EAMSS filtering to identify inappropriately quality scored bases towards the ends of reads and convert their quality scores to Q2.
arguments.name: --APPLY_EAMSS_FILTER

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: The barcodes directory with _barcode.txt files (generated by ExtractIlluminaBarcodes). If not set, use BASECALLS_DIR.
arguments.name: --BARCODES_DIR

arguments.summary: The basecalls directory.
arguments.name: --BASECALLS_DIR

arguments.summary: Compress output FASTQ files using gzip and append a .gz extension to the file names.
arguments.name: --COMPRESS_OUTPUTS

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: If set, this is the first tile to be processed (used for debugging).  Note that tiles are not processed in numerical order.
arguments.name: --FIRST_TILE

arguments.summary: The barcode of the flowcell that was sequenced; required if emitting Casava1.8-style read name headers
arguments.name: --FLOWCELL_BARCODE

arguments.summary: If true, call System.gc() periodically.  This is useful in cases in which the -Xmx value passed is larger than the available memory.
arguments.name: --FORCE_GC

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Whether to ignore reads whose barcodes are not found in MULTIPLEX_PARAMS.  Useful when outputting FASTQs for only a subset of the barcodes in a lane.
arguments.name: --IGNORE_UNEXPECTED_BARCODES

arguments.summary: Whether to include non-PF reads
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_NON_PF_READS

arguments.summary: Lane number. This can be specified multiple times. Reads with the same index in multiple lanes will be added to the same output file.
arguments.name: --LANE

arguments.summary: The name of the machine on which the run was sequenced; required if emitting Casava1.8-style read name headers
arguments.name: --MACHINE_NAME

arguments.summary: Configure SortingCollections to store this many records before spilling to disk. For an indexed run, each SortingCollection gets this value/number of indices. Deprecated: use `MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM`
arguments.name: --MAX_READS_IN_RAM_PER_TILE

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The minimum quality (after transforming 0s to 1s) expected from reads.  If qualities are lower than this value, an error is thrown.The default of 2 is what the Illumina's spec describes as the minimum, but in practice the value has been observed lower.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_QUALITY

arguments.summary: Tab-separated file for creating all output FASTQs demultiplexed by barcode for a lane with single IlluminaBasecallsToFastq invocation.  The columns are OUTPUT_PREFIX, and BARCODE_1, BARCODE_2 ... BARCODE_X where X = number of barcodes per cluster (optional).  Row with BARCODE_1 set to 'N' is used to specify an output_prefix for no barcode match.
arguments.name: --MULTIPLEX_PARAMS

arguments.summary: The number of threads to run in parallel. If NUM_PROCESSORS = 0, number of cores is automatically set to the number of cores available on the machine. If NUM_PROCESSORS < 0, then the number of cores used will be the number available on the machine less NUM_PROCESSORS.
arguments.name: --NUM_PROCESSORS

arguments.summary: The prefix for output FASTQs.  Extensions as described above are appended.  Use this option for a non-barcoded run, or for a barcoded run in which it is not desired to demultiplex reads into separate files by barcode.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_PREFIX

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: The read name header formatting to emit.  Casava1.8 formatting has additional information beyond Illumina, including: the passing-filter flag value for the read, the flowcell name, and the sequencer name.
arguments.name: --READ_NAME_FORMAT

arguments.summary:
A description of the logical structure of clusters in an Illumina Run, i.e. a description of the structure IlluminaBasecallsToSam assumes the  data to be in. It should consist of integer/character pairs describing the number of cycles and the type of those cycles (B for Sample Barcode, M for molecular barcode, T for Template, and S for skip).  E.g. If the input data consists of 80 base clusters and we provide a read structure of "28T8M8B8S28T" then the sequence may be split up into four reads:
* read one with 28 cycles (bases) of template
* read two with 8 cycles (bases) of molecular barcode (ex. unique molecular barcode)
* read three with 8 cycles (bases) of sample barcode
* 8 cycles (bases) skipped.
* read four with 28 cycles (bases) of template
The skipped cycles would NOT be included in an output SAM/BAM file or in read groups therein.
arguments.name: --READ_STRUCTURE

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: The barcode of the run.  Prefixed to read names.
arguments.name: --RUN_BARCODE

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, the output records are sorted by read name. Otherwise they are output in the same order that the data was produced on the sequencer (ordered by tile and position).
arguments.name: --SORT

arguments.summary: If set, process no more than this many tiles (used for debugging).
arguments.name: --TILE_LIMIT

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

name: IlluminaBasecallsToFastq (Picard)
